hip_shape

visualiser module¶

Conatins methods used to make a mayavi visualiser along with a data source. Most of the classes are unused.

class visualiser.DataSource(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

dependent class of observer pattern. Currently not being used. Switched to a generator based approach to visualisation

Methods

get_data()

This needs to be ovewritten for each new class

notifyObservers()

Notufy the observers that the data has changed

registerObserver(observer)

Registers an observer who is then updated each time the data is changed in DataSource

removeObserver(observer)

Cycles the list of observers registered so far, checks which element is equal to observer and removes the observer

This needs to be ovewritten for each new class

Returns

Return type

display_data()[source]¶
class visualiser.HipDataSource(pickle_path: str, decimator=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: data_utils.HipData, visualiser.DataSource

Subclass of data_utils.HipData and visualiser.DataSource.

Parameters

  • pickle_path (str) -- path to pickle file output of data_cleaning.to_pickle

  • decimator (data_utils.Decimator) -- the decimator object to be used

  • kwargs --

Attributes
APP_coords

returns the app plane coodinates

LPEL

returns the left pelvis point cloud. if self.rot_mat is not None, the points are rotated.

RPEL

returns the right pelvis point cloud. if self.rot_mat is not None, the points are rotated.

left_socket

returns the left socket plane crest points. if self.rot_mat is not None, the points are rotated.

right_socket

returns the right socket plane crest points. if self.rot_mat is not None, the points are rotated.

rot_mat

Return the rotation matrix that makes the data rotation invariant.

trans_vect

Returns the translation vector required to make the data translation invariant

Methods

decimate(max_num_faces[, save_path, ...])

Calls meshlib to reduce the number of faces in the RPel and LPel surfaces.

get_data()

returns the surface of the Left and right pelvis as list [vertice,connectivity_matrix]

get_plotly_graph([color])

Returns the plotly 3d graph associated with each of the left and right pelvis

notifyObservers()

Notufy the observers that the data has changed

registerObserver(observer)

Registers an observer who is then updated each time the data is changed in DataSource

removeObserver(observer)

Cycles the list of observers registered so far, checks which element is equal to observer and removes the observer

rotate(points)

Rotates a set of points by using self.rot_mat.

save_data(location)

Saves self.data as a pickle file.

set_data(pickle_path)

Method to change the data in the

translate(points)

Rotates a set of points by using self.trans_vect.
get_data() → list[source]¶

returns the surface of the Left and right pelvis as list [vertice,connectivity_matrix]

Returns

Return type

set_data(pickle_path: str)[source]¶

Method to change the data in the

Parameters

data --

Returns

Return type

update_visualisation()[source]¶
class visualiser.MayaviVisualiser(generator, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: visualiser.MayaviObserver

Main visualiser to be paired with loops.

Parameters

generator -- python generator object whose output of __next__ is a list of points,faces which represent the

array of vertex coordinates and face indices respectively such that points[faces[:,i]] are the coordinates of the i-th triangle. :type generator: generator :param kwargs: :type kwargs:

class visualiser.Observer[source]¶

Bases: object

Base Observer class

Methods

set_data(data)

method to read in the data

display_data
display_data()[source]¶
set_data(data: list)[source]¶

method to read in the data

:param data:data[0] should be vertices, and data[1] should be connectivity matrix of vertices, :type data: :return: :rtype:

class visualiser.SafeTimedThread(thread_condition, scan_time, funct, *funct_args)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Testing threding to update mayavi visualiser.

Attributes
daemon

A boolean value indicating whether this thread is a daemon thread.

ident

Thread identifier of this thread or None if it has not been started.

name

A string used for identification purposes only.

native_id

Native integral thread ID of this thread, or None if it has not been started.

Methods

is_alive()

Return whether the thread is alive.

join([timeout])

Wait until the thread terminates.

run()

Method representing the thread's activity.

start()

Start the thread's activity.

getName

isDaemon

setDaemon

setName
run()[source]¶

Method representing the thread's activity.

You may override this method in a subclass. The standard run() method invokes the callable object passed to the object's constructor as the target argument, if any, with sequential and keyword arguments taken from the args and kwargs arguments, respectively.
